sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Find the solution of the system of linear equations using QR decomposition method:
 
x + 2y - z = 5
 
2x + 3y + z = 3
 
3x + 4y - z = 7
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using the QR decomposition method, we first need to rewrite the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 1  2 -1 |
    | 2  3  1 |
    | 3  4 -1 |

b = | 5 |
    | 3 |
    | 7 |

Now, we need to find the QR decomposition of matrix A, where Q is an orthogonal matrix and R is an upper triangular matrix.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = a1 = | 1 |
          | 2 |
          | 3 |

u2 = a2 - proj(u1, a2) = |  2 - (1/14)*14  |
                          |  3 - (1/14)*20  |
                          |  4 - (1/14)*28  |

u2 = | 0 |
     | 1 |
     | 2 |

u3 = a3 - proj(u1, a3) - proj(u2, a3) = | -1 - (1/14)*(-6) - (1/5)*(-1) |
                                        |  1 - (1/14)*(-8) - (1/5)*( 1) |
                                        | -1 - (1/14)*(-12) - (1/5)*( 2) |

u3 = | 0 |
     | 0 |
     | 1 |

Now, normalize the orthogonal basis vectors to obtain the orthonormal basis:

q1 = u1 / ||u1|| = | 1/√14 |
                   | 2/√14 |
                   | 3/√14 |

q2 = u2 / ||u2|| = | 0     |
                   | 1/√5  |
                   | 2/√5  |

q3 = u3 / ||u3|| = | 0 |
                   | 0 |
                   | 1 |

Now, we can form the Q matrix:

Q = | 1/√14  0      0 |
    | 2/√14  1/√5   0 |
    | 3/√14  2/√5   1 |

Next, we can find the R matrix using the formula R = Q^T * A:

R = | 1/√14  2/√14  3/√14 | | 1  2 -1 |
    | 0      1/√5  2/√5  | | 2  3  1 |
    | 0      0      1    | | 3  4 -1 |

R = | √14  2√14  -√14 |
    |  0    √5     0  |
    |  0    0       1  |

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^T * b:

Q^T * b = | 1/√14  2/√14  3/√14 | | 5 |
          | 0      1/√5  2/√5  | | 3 |
          | 0      0      1    | | 7 |

Q^T * b = | 5√14/14 + 6√14/14 + 21√14/14 |
          | 3/√5 + 6/√5            |
          | 7                      |

Q^T * b = | 32√14/14 |
          |  9/√5    |
          |  7       |

Now, we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^T * b using back-substitution:

x = | 32√14/14 |
    |  9/√5    |
    |  7       |

x = | 2 |
    | 1 |
    | 7 |

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is x = 2, y = 1, and z = 7.
